src:
Bolivia confirmó que no viajará a Chile para jugar amistoso ante la Roja
Desde la federación altiplánica entregaron la noticia durante este lunes.
04 Nov 2019 by Claudio Caldera
Una rotunda decisión tomaron en Bolivia debido a la crisis social que hace semanas está afectando al país, ya que determinaron no viajar para jugar el amistoso ante la Roja en noviembre. 
El vicepresidente de la federación altiplanica, Robert Blanco, sostuvo a La Tercera que "lo único que hasta ahora está ratificado es que ya no va el partido el día 15 de noviembre”, junto con asegurar que el partido no ha sido reprogramado. 
Pese a que aún no se decidía la sede del compromiso, desde la ANFP asumieron las complicaciones y finalmente acataron la decisión boliviana, según logró verificar ADN Deportes la tarde de este lunes.
Respecto al duelo con Perú, que se disputará como forastero, hasta el momento se jugaría.
text:
Bolivia confirmed that it will not travel to Chile to play friendly against the Red
From the highland federation delivered the news during this Monday.
04 Nov 2019 by Claudio Caldera
A resounding decision was made in Bolivia due to the social crisis that has been affecting the country weeks ago, since they determined not to travel to play the friendly against the Red in November.
The vice president of the highland federation, Robert Blanco, told La Tercera that "the only thing that has been ratified so far is that the game is no longer on November 15," along with ensuring that the party has not been rescheduled.
Although the headquarters of the commitment had not yet been decided, from the ANFP they assumed the complications and finally complied with the Bolivian decision, as DNA Sports verified on Monday afternoon.
Regarding the duel with Peru, which will be played as an outsider, so far it would be played.
